title: Second man charged after two teens stabbed to death at house party
text:
Dom Ansah and Ben Gilham-Rice, both 17, were stabbed to death at a house party in Milton Keynes (Picture: PA)

Police have warned they will publicly identify suspects in the stabbing murder of two teenagers at a Milton Keynes house party if they do not come forward.

A second man will appear in court today after Dom Ansah and Ben Gillham-Rice, both 17, were stabbed to death on October 19.

Dom is thought to have died from a knife wound to the back while Ben was knifed in the chest, according to police.

Thames Valley Police issued an appeal on Friday and warned those suspected of being involved would be named in public.

Detective Chief Superintendent Ian Hunter said: ‘We are still looking for others and they know who they are.

Dom Ansah, 17, was one of two victims stabbed to death at a housing estate in Emerson Valley, Milton Keynes (Picture: PA)

Ben Gillham-Rice, 17, died after being knifed in the chest (Picture: PA)

An artist’s impression of the defendant Charlie Chandler when he appeared at Milton Keynes Magistrates’ Court (Picture: PA)

‘I want to appeal directly to those people.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘We are looking for you and we will find you, however long it takes.

‘At this stage we have not released your names or photographs, so please hand yourself in to the nearest police station as soon as possible.

‘This is not going to go away and if we have to, we will name you so there will be no place for you to hide.’

Earl Bevans, 22, of no fixed abode, will appear at High Wycombe Magistrates’ Court on Saturday charged with two counts of murder in connection with the attack.

Bevans also faces two counts of attempted murder after Ryan Brown, 23, and a 17-year-old boy, who cannot be named for legal reasons, were left with serious but non-life-threatening injuries.

Charlie Chandler, of Bletchley, 21, has also been charged with two counts of murder and two counts of attempted murder.

Yesterday Chandler appeared at Milton Keynes Magistrates’ Court and is due to appear at Luton Crown Court on Monday.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: Thames Valley Police have also warned suspects in the Milton Keynes stabbing murders could be named in public.
